name: Velamar Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned from 1 week holiday at the Velamar on November 6th and we had a really lovely holiday. There is not much to be said that has not been said already but I would definitely go back to the Velamar and we are planning a return next year.
reviews.title: Lovely holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were all very helpful and friendly, the cleanliness was exceptional and the location was perfect for us. There are lots of shops and bars if you go left out of the hotel and also a supermarket we also went this way to the beach every day as the weather was fantastic. Also visited Old town which was very pretty and interesting. Just around the corner is Soft Caffe which is run by a lovely family and the son Bruno is the waiter his mum makes lovely food and cakes and this is worth a try but we would not recommend you visit 3 Marias as it was not a nce experience, staff were nice but food and decor were awful! Well just to say would recommend a stay at Velamar it is a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Velamar Hotel is a lovely, comfortable and clean hotel in a reasonably good location. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive from the main strip and old town. Not sure how available public transport is. The hotel itself was nice, rooms were spacious and had everything you needed. The restaurant was good with a lot of choice, buffet style continental breakfast. It's definitely value for money.
reviews.title: Good value for money provided you are not too fussy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read previous reviews I decided to go for it. Upon arrival, which was late, the reception staff were very friendy and gave me a bottle of cold water as I had arrived at 12.30 in the morning.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, clean with a fridge and tv. A bit disappointing that there were no tea/coffee making facilities, however having said that the apartment did have a safetey deposit box which is charged at about 4 euros a day with a refundable deposite of about 12 euros.
reviews.title: excellent trip good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location outside albufeira 40mins walk on main road, beach was 15min walk but worth it, sunbeds were expensive 15euros for 2 beds and shade. staff in hotel very helpful and friendly, nice bar area drinks not expensive, no evening meals available, rooms were basic average size small balcony. hotel in residencial area, pool small very hot in august beach was better and cooler, some nice restaurants close by, we went to 3marias a few times great set menu and great value 11euros 3 courses, soft cafe was also very good and great cheap drink and wine, we really enjoyed our holiday there is enough in immediate area to do you at night, ther is a square down in olhas d'agua nice walk in evening, good atmosphere, lots of restaurants onway, we did a few trips which were v good just booked from hotel, air con worked well and was needed. all in all we had a great holiday on a budget.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived early but hotel were so friendly and managed to give us keys to one of our rooms so that we could store our bags and go out. Very quickly the second room was made available and the receptionist came to find us to tell us - very efficient. Rooms clean and had balcony, tv, fridge and haidryer.Clean towels daily. In terms of location was 10 mins walk from the beach and a short 7Euros approx cab ride into Albufeira old town where we found lots of bars and resaurants, however not actually in Albufeira itself. Continental breakfast included in price and was more than adequate. Great hotel for a short stay with friends.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel , perfect for a long weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spotless hotel nicely furnished. Obliging friendly staff. Lovely fresh breakfasts in airy rooftop terrace overlooking sea - food never ran out was constantly replenished and breakfast was until 10.30am which is a bonus. Bad points - lumpiest pillows I've ever come across. Uncomfortable sunbeds and very small pool and surrounding pool area. 30 minute powerwalk into Albufeira itself - and there are some hills. There are half dozen restaurants right next to Hotel though. Good 10 minute walk from beach and very steep hill to it.
reviews.title: Go here if you want value for money .......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But no-one I spoke to in the Hotel could get over the value - for the price we all paid it is excellent and I would definitely return for another cheap late break.
reviews.title: unbelievable value in a quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back home two days ago after spending 14 nights in the 'Velamar Hotel'. I truthfully could have stayed another week as the holiday was so good. All the good reviews that this hotel have received are absolutely correct and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. I will definitely return.
reviews.title: Fantasic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Velamar for 3 nights in october. We paid 75 euros b+b for our entire stay which is really good value for money. The breakfast is very good but very continental, dont expect egg and bacon. Its help yourself so if you take a bag up with you, you can have ham and cheese rolls for lunch he he. Also the breakfast room is on the top floor (third) and overlooks the sea which is very nice. The hotel is very clean, nice bar area with free wifi but you can connect in your room which was a bit annoying. The staff are excellent, very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size, nice bathroom and balcony, aircon and the tv has a couple of english channels. The only downside was the bed was very hard. The pool area was o.k, only half of the area gets sun from about 11am onwards, but the most annoying thing was constantly being pestered by flies. They will land and crawl over you all day long.
reviews.title: Excellent value for Money!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Velamar was a bargain, and we purely booked on the strength of the Trip Advisor reviews. It lived up to my expectations and more. Big room, huge bed and balcony, very clean, fridge, hairdryer, excellent double glazing, great shower, fab breakfasts and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Go on, you won't regret it. But maybe take your own pillows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful Maria Luisa beach is less than 10 minutes walk if you follow the blue and red signs to Passaro Azul restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative comments are that the bed was the hardest I have ever "slept" on, and the pillows, less than useless. Although my back pain was cured by the end of the fortnight! Also, take ear plugs, as the guests doors slamming, chairs scraping and loud voices seem to carry through the vents and prevent the all important lie in.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Albufeira old town is well worth a bus or taxi trip, but Olhos D'Agua has more restaurants than you need, Caixote at the end of the promenade near the fishermans huts is amazing. I asked for octopus and rice, not on the menu but we'd seen the locals having it at lunch... Fabulous fish soup too! Jollies near the hotel was also good if you don't want to wander too far.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel!! should be rated 4 star!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from spending a week at the velamar.the hotel is very clean and well kept and all the staff are friendly and very efficient.the continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful.
reviews.title: amazing value for money,highly recomend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my only little niggle was that i thought the bed was to hard but my wife who suffers from a bad back thought it was fantastic .
reviews.title: Very clean hotel - shame about the noise of other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: overall a great hotel we would highly recomend and plan going back asap
reviews.title: Blissful Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviews made this hotel out to be better than what it was. Couldnt fault the cleanliness (although there was a black rim of dirt around the pool's water level), and we had a bad problem with flies around the pool (you couldnt relax cos you were always squatting the pesky things - it was probably due to the fact that some of the houses next to the hotel kept chickens and other animals). The breakfast food was delicious (didnt like the jam and marmalade though and there could have been some eggs) - there was always a queue for the toaster though (for the number of guests, there should have been two of them - it only did 6 slices at a time!). The staff were really friendly and efficient. What really spoiled it though was the noise at night and early mornings - we had asked when booking (6 months prior) for a 'quiet' room but on arrival were allocated a room directly outside the lifts!!! We asked to be moved, but were told the hotel was full - we also had a room underneath one of the main hotel air-con units which was going on and off all night. Each room has TILED floors - which is probably ok for the cleaners, but makes the acoustics of the rooms horrendous - you can hear TV's, people shouting to each other (some were really inconsiderate that people may be sleeping), furniture scraping across the tiled floors and people walking about.- there should be carpets in the rooms. The beds werent that comfy (2 singles pushed together that had mattresses so hard I was in pain. Also, the room doors slamming gets on your nerves - the doors have entry 'cards' but to close them on exit you need to use the card as well to take the lock off - most people were just slamming them shut! On our side of the hotel there were some villas (5 in total, which had about 8 dogs between them) so all we could hear was dogs barking (one barked, which set them all off and the owners didnt seem to give a s**t). If the hotel were to make a few changes to eliminate the noises, it would be a lovely place to stay - they could also do with putting on lunchime and evening meals, as it was a pain to have to go out of the hotel every night just to have a meal. Local restaurants are very good - Tiffanys (Indian), Cozy (Chinese) had lovely food but if you want a good meal deal, go to the 3 Marias further down.
reviews.title: value for money but poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said, this hotel really is value for money, great staff, good location, not far from the main town of albufeira on the local bus link... lots of attractions nearby which you can avail off. We just wanted a quiet break with nice weather, the weather didn't oblige on all days getting two days of heavy rain but the rest of the time was lovely. Lovely beach within walking distance from hotel, you can go right to Maria Luisa beach and walk all along the beach to the main beach in town when tide is out. Lovely walk in the morning. Cliff walks.. Lovely restaurants where you can eat 4 courses from tourist menu for 9euro per head or there are other restaurants around town. There is something to suit all pockets. The pool was lovely as we are not swimmers and only needed somewhere to cool off. We have no faults with the Velamar and would highly recommend it our only fault was the beds were too hard!!!...
reviews.title: great hotel- friendly staff,perfect break

description: Hotel Velamar is a 3-star hotel in Olhos de Água (Albufeira), right in the heart of the famous tourism region in Southern Portugal, Algarve.The hotel is 890m away from the "Maria Luisa" and "Olhos de Água" beaches and the prestigious Quinta da Balaia. Albufeira old town is located 6km away and Faro International Airport within 25km.All the 73 rooms and 2 suites are equipped with mini-bar, air conditioning, safe, telephone, satellite TV and private bathroom.The hotel has free parking and wifi internet, swimming pool, bar and restaurant.
